alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Crockett; Dyer; Gibson; Haywood; Lauderdale (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued February 16 at 10:21AM CST until February 16 at 12:30PM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: The National Weather Service in Memphis has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... West Central Carroll County in Tennessee... Crockett County in Tennessee... Southeastern Dyer County in Tennessee... Gibson County in Tennessee... Central Haywood County in Tennessee... Eastern Lauderdale County in Tennessee... * Until 1230 PM CST. * At 1021 AM CST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 7 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Brownsville, Humboldt, Ripley, Milan, Trenton, Alamo, Bells, Dyer, Halls, Rutherford, Bradford, Atwood, Eaton, Chestnut Bluff, Belle Eagle, Holly Grove, Forked Deer, Nutbush, Medina and Henning. There is widespread flash flooding across Gibson County with many roads closed including Jack Spence Road. Numerous roads in Dyer, Tennessee are flooded including Old Dyer Yorkville and New Bethlehem Road. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

area.areaDesc: Carroll; Crockett; Dyer; Gibson; Haywood; Lauderdale
